channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no 19 Highgate West Hill N6 6NP (Camden borough), 3rd September
item.description:
20 m/h speed sign is twisted and not visible to drivers coming up the hill. Due to constant speeding issues and dangers it poses to residents and small children living on the street, it needs to be addressed ASAP. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Highgate West Hill, Highgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytiipping Millbrook Avenue by El Sub Station, 3rd September
item.description:
Someone has dumped furniture (chest of drawers). It has all been broken into pieces. It has been there for about a week and is blocking the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Millbrook Avenue, Falconwood, London

item.title: Abandoned first mile wheelie bin, 3rd September
item.description:
The Frist Mile branded wheelie bin has been abandoned on the road for the past couple of weeks. Rubbish has collected around it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goodchild Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entire length of pavement is uneven dangerous with multiple trip hazards, 3rd September
item.description:
In Harland avenue from the junction of Cornwallis avenue to Brooklands avenue the pavement is an almost continuous series of dangerous trip hazards , ( two photos attached ) but there are many many more broken slabs and tree damage . This is a “ walk to school “ route to Dulveton school ( primary ) and adults and children ( including my grandson ) are tripping up , falling over on a daily basis . Please repair or replace this before a serious accident and a legal action against bexley happens .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 144, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on pavement, 3rd September
item.description:
The residents don't seem to want to move their bins, ever. While travelling along here my companion had to use the grass verge due to her wheelchair. The rain caused the grass to be wet and she invariably got stuck. Luckily a passerby helped but it was still both dangerous and embarrassing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birling Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: The grass area outside St Pauls church facing south villas, 3rd September
item.description:
I am writing to express my concerns regarding the lack of adequate lighting in the area around my home, especially considering the seating that has recently been installed by the council, which faces my property. (The grass area outside St Pauls Church Camden Terrace/South Villas) The insufficient lighting in this area not only makes it difficult for residents to feel safe but also creates a potentially dangerous environment. I have noticed that people are able to sit in this area at all hours, which raises concerns for me as a foster carer. It is unsettling to have individuals watching my home at night, and I believe this situation needs to be addressed for the safety and comfort of the community. We didnt ask for Benches to be put on this site in the first place. It has made the area a magnet for unsociable behaviour and as it is SO dark in that area, the unsocial behaviour is under cover. I kindly urge the council to consider enhancing the lighting in this area to improve safety for all residents. Your attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for listening, and I look forward to your response. Best regards, Sarah Livingstone Chair of CAFC Co-Founder of Replenish Culture
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Villas, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
